head.title: National Briefing | West: Hawaii: Army Exercises To Resume

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | West: Hawaii: Army Exercises To Resume

block.p: Ater a three-year delay, the Army is to resume training with live ammunition today in the Makua Valley in Hawaii. Training had been halted since September 1998, when it caused a large fire that led to a lawsuit by local environmentalists. Under an agreement reached early this month, the Army will conduct a study of the training's impact on the environment within three years. Today's training will include artillery and aircraft fire in support of troops advancing down a corridor, said Maj. Nancy Makowski, a spokeswoman for the Army.
